\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 96516}

\subsection*{Very Strange Reaction}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{TBAAT}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 200 mg & oral & Pharms - Sertraline & pill / tablet\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 140.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I took 200 mg of zoloft and about 40 minutes later I went to go take a shower. As I stepped in I noticed my hands were shaking. About 5 minutes later my heart started to beat super fast and I felt like I was gonna have a heart attack. I sat down felt a little better. Then about 30 minutes later I threw up, which is very strange because I have a very hardy stomach and almost never through up. I looked in the mirror and my face was all sweaty and red. After that I felt much better but my hands were still shaking.   



I would not recommend taking zoloft, in my opinion it really sucks.

\end{document}
